analysis.name: UnitedHealthcare
reviews: My claims processing was a nightmare after the Change Healthcare cyberattack; getting prescriptions filled and seeing doctors was severely disrupted, and it took weeks to sort out payments.

Despite being told my treatment was covered, UnitedHealthcare repeatedly denied prior authorization for necessary care, forcing me to appeal multiple times and creating immense stress and unexpected bills.
The premiums have increased significantly year after year without any clear explanation of added value, making it incredibly difficult to budget for essential health coverage.

Customer service wait times are often excessive, and when I finally connect with someone, they frequently provide conflicting information or are unable to resolve complex issues, especially regarding billing.
It's nearly impossible to get clear, transparent information on what my out-of-pocket costs will truly be, leading to constant anxiety about surprise medical bills even with 'coverage'.
description: UnitedHealthcare is the health insurance arm of UnitedHealth Group, one of the largest healthcare companies in the world. It provides health benefit programs for individuals, employers, and Medicare and Medicaid beneficiaries, covering tens of millions of people.

• **Change Healthcare Cyberattack (2024):** A severe ransomware attack on Change Healthcare, an Optum (UHG subsidiary) company, caused widespread disruption to pharmacy services, claims processing, and payments across the entire U.S. healthcare system, severely impacting providers and patients for weeks and highlighting vulnerabilities within UHG's integrated operations.

• **Prior Authorization Denials & Lawsuits:** UnitedHealthcare has faced numerous lawsuits and regulatory scrutiny for allegedly denying medically necessary care through overly restrictive prior authorization processes, including claims of using AI to automate denials for emergency room visits and post-acute care, and violating mental health parity laws.

• **Unexplained Premium Increases:** A persistent and widespread complaint from policyholders involves frequent and substantial premium increases, often without clear justification or corresponding improvements in benefits or services.

• **Antitrust & Market Dominance Concerns:** UnitedHealth Group has faced ongoing scrutiny from federal regulators (DOJ, FTC) regarding its vast market dominance and vertical integration with Optum (which includes pharmacies, PBMs, and provider groups), raising concerns about potential anti-competitive practices.
